target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The audit reported no findings and classified the contract as safe, but the contract contains a denial-of-service vulnerability in the emptyCreditors function. The function has a conditional that will revert if creditorAddresses.length <= 1500, which can be triggered by an attacker repeatedly calling addCreditors() to keep the array length at or below 1500, preventing legitimate users from ever successfully calling emptyCreditors().

notes: The audit failed to detect a clear denial-of-service vulnerability. The emptyCreditors() function can be blocked by an attacker who repeatedly calls addCreditors() to keep creditorAddresses.length <= 1500. Each addCreditors() call adds 350 addresses (all msg.sender), so an attacker needs to call it ~5 times to reach 1750, but can then call it again whenever the length approaches 1500 from below, preventing the condition creditorAddresses.length > 1500 from ever being true. This is a classic transaction-order-dependency DoS where the attacker can frontrun legitimate calls to emptyCreditors().
